New Records: Virat Kohli is chasing a century that will put him where no man has ever gone before - 50 ODI tons.
The highest-ever team total at the stadium is 401/6 by New Zealand, which they posted in ICC World Cup 2023.
Bas de Leede has 18 wickets in the death overs (41-50) since the start of 2022.
Bengaluru has the best runs-per-wicket ratio - 36.45 - at this World Cup, marginally ahead of Pune (35.82) and Mumbai (35.73).
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma charged out of his crease for a six that startled a kite perched on the stadium's roof.
India have been absolutely dominant during their 8-0 run at this World Cup.
The bowlers - the whole lot of them - put the line-up through a serious inquisition.
Pre-Game Insights: India look to go 9-0 in the World Cup as they take on Netherlands.
Rahul Dravid hints that there won't be any tinkering with personnel with just a week to go in the World Cup.
Netherlands will have their own statement to make, with a chance to shine in what will most likely be their team's most-watched game of international cricket.
Post-Match Reflections: The Indian side is on a run of dominance and sheer range of performances.
The Dutch have put together a laudable World Cup campaign with notable wins over South Africa and Bangladesh.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is a chance for some loud statement-making in one of the loudest settings in international cricket.
The pitch at Bengaluru Stadium is considered good for batting and many teams have posted big totals at the stadium.
Others: The Chinnaswamy Stadium has witnessed 41 ODIs so far, with the team batting first won 15 games while the team batting second won 22 matches.
